treatment.reference: Characterization of a new mesophilic, secondary alcohol-utilizing methanogen, Methanobacterium palustre spec. nov. from a peat bog Arch Microbiol 151:1-9
treatment.description: Rod-shaped cells, 0.5 µm wide by 2.5-5 µm in length, occasionally form filaments of up to 65 µn. Gram-positive, non-motile. Colonies on agar medium are yellowish, round, convex with a smooth surface, 2- 3 mm in diameter. Temperature optimum around 37˚C, pH optimum around 7.0. No salt-requirement, but tolerates 1.8% NaCl. Utilizes H2/CO2, formate, 2-propanol/CO2 and 2-butanol/ CO2 for growth and/or methane production. Grows autotrophically on H2/CO2. The G + C content of the DNA is 34 mol% (Tm). The habitat is a marshy soil in the Sippenauer Moor close to Kelheim/Bavaria. The type strain is strain F (DSM 3108).
